org.jtrim.event

Interface TrackedEventListener<ArgType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ArgType - the type of the event specific argument

    public interface TrackedEventListener<ArgType>
    Defines an event listener for TrackedListenerManager instances of an EventTracker. This listener interface accepts the causes of the events and an additional event specific argument. Although this listener interface was designed to be used by EventTracker instances, the general use of this listener encouraged where a listener of events is required.

    Thread safety

    Listeners are not generally required to be safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently. The source of events defines the required thread-safety property for the listener instances.

    Synchronization transparency

    Listeners are not required to be synchronization transparent. Note however, that usually listeners should only do computationally cheap operations and should also not wait for external events to occur or for other threads. This is because usually multiple listeners needed to be notified and a slow listener might hurt the responsiveness of an application.
    See Also:
    EventTracker, TrackedEvent, TrackedListenerManager

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onEvent(TrackedEvent<ArgType> trackedEvent)
      This method is called when the event of which this listener had been registered to be notified, occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • onEvent

        void onEvent(TrackedEvent<ArgType> trackedEvent)
        This method is called when the event of which this listener had been registered to be notified, occurs.

        It is highly recommended to write listeners to be computationally cheap, so it may not hurt the responsiveness of an application.

        Parameters:
        trackedEvent - the causes of the events and the event specific argument. This argument cannot be null.
